text: back in April
we the Dean's office
asked us to think about
what we might do differently were there
to be a downturn
so we met as a team in April with
students and faculty and brainstormed
for half a day on what we thought we
could do differently how could we
rethink our business to better support
students and employers during a downturn
that plan was finessed over the summer
and
I had it on a folder on my desk
and in September pulled it out and said
I think it's time to to to start
executing
so you know from our perspective we were
well we had a plan in place we were we
were ready for whatever came
um our way
um this has happened pretty quickly I
don't think we expected it to be this
quick but at the same time we were
pretty quick to execute on the plan so I
feel like our students are in a good
place they're very well supported what
does that support look like on the
student side we have as we've always had
a very robust coaching program
we have added to our coaches for this
year we've added
five to ten coaches focused on with with
direct experience in the financial
services sector which we think is a
tremendous help to our students as they
think about well if this if this area in
finance is not available to me what are
other areas that may be
places for me to land out of here so
those Finance coaches are very helpful
in that front and the coaching programs
used by over 80 percent of the students
on campus and a very highly rated
program so we feel really good about
that
we have also increased all of our
programs for students whether it's
um creating your vision crafting your
resume all of the programs and steps
along the way we have programs to put
towards that and we've increased those
programs we're doing more for
international students who are looking
for jobs uh overseas or any student
actually looking for a job overseas and
trying to enable that through better
services and video conferencing and the
rest in terms of employers
we are doing more employer Outreach
bringing encouraging more employers to
come to campus or at least post jobs we
have conferences planned in Paris and
Shanghai for this year and our team
travels are truly around the globe year
round making sure we have the most
up-to-date information our fingers on
the pulse and what's happening as well
as encouraging companies to post jobs on
campus for our students so all of that
is happening and at the same time we are
continuing to support the class of 08.
so as they continue on their job search
and or as their situations change due to
the crisis we are supporting that class
through this
statement so our mission statement reads
to enable each student in the
realization of a unique career vision
and what is that what does that mean
what are some keywords in there the
first is enable
and that is really the difference
between I think a placement service and
a career development office
our as we see our role it is to provide
the best tools resources and support for
students to enable them in their career
search so that's how we see our role
many of them are trying to figure out
what it is they want to do and we have
coaches and programs to help them do
that we bring companies to campus we
help them go see companies through
tracks career tracks
London banking days all sorts of
different events so our role is very
much to enable not to say we think this
is the right job for you
uh in general
um I've had people say ask me the
question are students panicked what's
happening on campus are you seeing a lot
of anxiety I don't see Panic that's not
what I'm experiencing on campus I'm
experiencing students who are aware
who are very thoughtful and mindful of
what's Happening who are trying to
incorporate what's happening on a global
economic scale to what that means for
them and their career so they're
realistic they're certainly a level of
uncertainty and anxiety but not panic
um and have I heard of students or do I
know of students who have drastically
changed what they want to do you know in
in our program we focus on
getting students to focus on the five to
seven year Vision those Visions haven't
changed what's changed
for some is how they might get there so
they might have had a path plotted out
but there may be an obstacle on that
path right now so students are stepping
back and saying okay what are my other
avenues for getting there what are other
paths that could lead to the same
destination may take one or two hops and
may take less time or more time but
they're pursuing now multiple paths as
opposed to the one that they had
originally crafted about eighty percent
of the class changes function or
industry
while they're here so from what they did
before to what they end up doing leaving
here so it career switching is a very
common occurrence on this campus
and it's one of the reasons why the
summer internship is so important
because that allows for an opportunity
to gain new skills get inside an
organization understand what a new
function is
um
students are
still Keen to do that
um
companies are still open to that
it's a question of
for those who want to switch
everything function location and
Industry
it might take more time they might have
to do that in one two or three steps as
opposed to just one so we're getting
students to to think up front
what is it that you want to switch and
prioritizing one of those things for the
summer
and ideally it's function
that is
core to satisfaction in a job
and based on Tim Butler's research he's
found that that those interests are
pretty much set in their early 20s
all of our interests are set in our
early 20s so if we can nail that early
on it'll lead to Greater career
satisfaction down the road so helping
them figure out function first working
that into a summer internship plan and
then
pursuing the next step for full time
last year twice as many domestic
students took positions abroad and about
50 percent of our International students
accepted positions overseas so we are
seeing an increase I expect that that
will continue
um we are proactively going after those
opportunities through our conferences
abroad through our roundtables in London
um and actively supporting those
students through coaches who are in
those areas so we have coaches in Europe
we have coaches who focus on Asia that
are in go back and forth between Asia
and California and we have regional
directors within the school who focus on
the employer Outreach side so
it's I think we are actually in in a
good position to support those
opportunities and then you have many of
the multinational organizations that
recruit for those offices as well so the
international students are finding great
opportunities
um it seems to be where the students are
excited many of the students are excited
to be where there's a lot of opportunity
right now
MBA recruiting is a long-term
proposition for all these companies
they're recruiting now for leadership in
four to five years so many of the
organizations that are currently
experiencing this financial crisis are
still interested in hiring talent
because hopefully in four to five years
we'll be out of this so recruiting is
alive and well at the same time certain
paths are less there are a few
opportunities in certain paths so where
are students turning to
um we have seen an increase in the
social Enterprise area we are seeing
more students who want to make that
their first stop whereas before it might
have been something that they have
pursued 10 15 years down the road HBS
has a unique program in that area called
the leadership fellows program where we
co-sponsor leadership opportunities
within organizations such as the Bill
and Melinda Gates Foundation
those opportunities are very popular
this year applications are up over 30
for those positions
also seeing a large number of students
interested and more interested in
pursuing directly out of school
entrepreneurship so HPS alumni are
famous for the companies that they start
again they start them later in in down
their career path
we are seeing more students wanting to
go into entrepreneurship directly out of
school
